intro: Schaueria capitata, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and produces showy, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, and it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Schaueria capitata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and drought tolerance. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
